website_summaries.verdict: Unlike other travel steamers, this one does not leak or spit water, and it's easy enough for even an inexperienced user.
pros: It has many safety features and even comes with a glove to protect your hand
It heats up within seconds and features an auto shutoff
cons: While it's portable, it's not as small as some other steamers

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT DRIP!
customer_reviews.text: Not a person who enjoys ironing. Previously purchased the Rowenta steamer and it was terrible. THIS garment steamer impressed me so much that I'm taking time to review it. Most handheld steamers drip water everywhere so was kinda expecting this to do the same but boy, was I wrong! MIRACLE! This steamer had powerful steam coming out to do a very efficient job getting rid of the wrinkles but it DOES NOT drip (just a few drops but nothing major). I use the attached brush and worked well on my clothes. Highly recommended and definitely happy I took a chance so now now you don't! :)
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works well and does its job. Recommend. Better for lighter fabrics like silk, light polyester, light cotton. I steamed all sorts of shirts and found that the thicker he harder it works. But the thinner the material the quicker it works. As with any steamer but just sayin. Like this for a nice quick steam. Don’t think it would do a thick wedding dress very well or quickly. But for everyday clothing at home: def will do the job. See my vid
customer_reviews.author: Christina W

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: I know most people won’t heed this review because I know when I buy stuff on amazon If I’m really dead-set in something I’ll make my decision mostly on the good reviews, but anyways. I bought this Jan 30, 2019. It broke may 27, 2019. Spend a little more money and get one that doesn’t break.
customer_reviews.author: audrey

customer_reviews.title: Returned item
customer_reviews.text: I read several 5 star reviews and thought I had done enough research to be confident in my purchase of this steamer. Unfortunately, I am returning this item. I tried to steam both satin and chiffon fabric after reading the instructions thoroughly and following them to a “T,” but the wrinkles hardly came out. I hung the garments, stretched them, and held the steamer 2 inches from the fabric, but still the results were not effective or even satisfactory. I am really sad that I have to return this because I was hoping it would be quicker than ironing, but honestly my iron is looking much better after using this steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff Come with 3accessories
customer_reviews.text: I feel that is is much easy to use than the traditional iron and much lighter than the garment steamer. Sample and easy to use. I think I can take it to my next trip. It will fit into my suitecase. There is 3 extra accessories, haven’t try it yet but just let everyone know it . Value for money
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I must have gotten a defective unit. The steam did not get very hot, it just left my shirt wet and still wrinkled. I had a cheaper steamer that quit after 2 months so I splurged for this one thinking I’d get a better steamer for double the price but apparently I was wrong. I am planning on returning this. Also, I have no idea why the water spout is so tiny. I spent way too long just trying to fill up the water tank. Not practical. I’m gonna keep searching for a quality, durable steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shmo

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use! May never ever need to iron again!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and pretty fast! Bests getting out an ironing board any day. I use it on my hair, too, carefully....:-)
customer_reviews.author: A. Ramsaur

customer_reviews.title: Life saver! love the steamer, works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a great steamer. I always trying to iron my shirt at morning. But I never have enough time to do it. I saw this steamer with this price, so I bought it. I used for a week now, it is perfect! every morning only took me about 3 mins to iron my shirt. And my shirt looks fantastic. This makes me looks way nicer than before. Also, the steamer didn't feel cheap at all. It has really high quality. I already told my mom to get one for my dad.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chen

customer_reviews.title: Not a good steamer at all
customer_reviews.text: This product didn’t work. Not enough steam to get the job done, and the item we were steaming was a bridal veil. If it can’t get the wrinkles out of that fine fabric, how will it get wrinkles out of thicker fabric? Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my trip to Europe. Purchased a beautiful silk pant set which was wrinkled when I wanted to wear it. Pulled out my brand new steamer to knock the wrinkles out and not only did it stop working it ruined my silk pants. I gave it #1 star for appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Used it once and then stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and it worked fine. Then I unplugged it, walked away, came back, plugged it back in to use it again and now it no longer produces steam and it doesn't heat up (green LED was solid green right away). Very disappointing. I tried to get them to replace it by contacting the seller directly but they haven't replied after a week. Looks like leaving a bad review worked for other people so that's what I'm doing. Will update my rating if it ever gets replaced. EDIT: Had some trouble getting them to send me a new one but they eventually did. The steamer works well so I updated my rating
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Easter

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and was very excited to use it. However, when turned on and warmed up, the steamer did not produce any steam and instead dripped water all over the clothing I wanted to steam. The instruction manual had troubleshooting information for if the water dripped from the water tank, but the water was coming from the steam head. The next time I tried to turn the steamer on, the water did not warm up and the green power button flashed for minutes without the steamer becoming warm. A support adviser from Amazon gave me great assistance and I will be trying a replacement product, so hopefully that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Update- exactly what I need!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this another try and I was not disappointed! It is easy to use and worked to get rid of wrinkles on casual polyester blend type dresses that can’t be ironed easily. Also worked on my husbands linen shirt that I had almost given up on because ironing seemed to not make much of a difference. Overall, i am very pleased. it saves me time and I have basically expanded my wardrobe since I can now wear some items I had stopped wearing since they were difficult to keep wrinkle free. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tia Steffen

customer_reviews.title: Water tank leaks. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this Beautural garment steamer because the bottom of the water tank is not sealed properly and leaks water easily. Please see my video. I thought mine was defective but noticed that other reviewers have also had the same problem since last year (Check out the one-star reviews). It seems the manufacturer has not corrected this issue. The other con is that it's a large steamer, and when it’s filled with water, it's heavy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: What a joke. It worked great for TWO days and then it stopped releasing steam. I don’t know where all the great reviews came from. I guess it could be because I actually paid for mine. I will be returning. UPDATE: The customer service team contacted me and sent a replacement. It has been working well for the past month. I will update if it seizes to work.
customer_reviews.author: Mariisz

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this Leaks when I use it and it also drips water everywhere. It doesn’t get very hot and it is hard to get wrinkles out. I was so confident in the reviews that I didn’t try this out right away when I bought it and so my return window has passed now. I’m so disappointed in this product, I got this one that cost a little more in hopes it was better quality and didn’t leak but it does. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Water Refill Hole WAY Too Small
customer_reviews.text: So this steamer works great... however... the hole to fill is super small. It's so small that water won't even drain out of it! The cup that comes with it to pour into the hole won't work and you'd have to run tap water very slowly to fill. I use distilled water in all my small appliances to avoid build up and you can't do that with this steamer because there's no way to get it in. I love the attachments and the steamer works great, but unfortunately too much of a hassle to refill.
customer_reviews.author: MBrown

customer_reviews.title: Nice handy steamer
customer_reviews.text: I am bad at ironing clothes and I couldn't iron my clothes without an iron pad. I found this product with so many good reviews and I love this steamer now. Pressing clothes is a lot easier with this steamer, and this steamer can be used to sanitize curtains and my sofa cushions and pillows easily. The steam kills the bacteria, atleast they feel cleaner than they were before. FIlling the water and using the steamer is simple and easy. This is small and easy to carry too. The cable outlet from the steamer is protected well to give longer life. make sure this is not accessible to children as it does not look like a regular iron box.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble from the first try
customer_reviews.text: Ok honestly sending it back as we speak. My issue with this is 1- water chamber is too small. Have to keep refilling an pulling the plug out to fill with water ain’t easy. In fact it’s annoying. 2- the water chamber kept falling to the floor spilling water everywhere. It fell so often that it finally cracked an started leaking. Disappointed in item
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Going back the same day!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this item based on the all the positive reviews and unfortunately I am returning this item. It leaked water all over my floor and all over the curtains I was steaming. It also doesn’t get a single wrinkle out. I received this item today and tried two different times to get it to work properly and had my husband try as well. Looks like you get what you pay for with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No water squirts!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first purchase of a steamer. I had seen a woman use one and went on Amazon and thought...a steamer is a steamer. Got it home and tested it out. I didn't read the directions and was able to figure it out quickly. I was super happy at my first experience. No water sprinkles like my steam iron. I then decided to read up andcrealized I can "iron" flat down or hanging such as my drapes as shown in my picture.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a little while now. At first it worked great, but now it leaks like crazy. Literally leaves a puddle on the ground, I have to put down towels on the floor and put the unit on a waterproof placemat while adjusting the shirt. I am looking for a new one. I may try to contact the company, but not sure I would want another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Update On Review
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful as I would have liked. It takes longer to heat up and doesn’t hold temperature long. Sad part is it was a Christmas gift. It spits out water leaving water marks and stains. I had high expectations of this product. Update: Seller sent a replacement for free. I’m glad they did because It works so much better than the defect one. It heats up quicker and no longer spits out water. The safety guard actually works. The person we purchased it for was very happy to receive the replacement and how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Dymon's Knowledge

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was wary it wouldn't work at all or die after the first couple uses. I've used it a few times now and it seems to work perfectly. It is a little heavy to hold, but that's fine since you only use for 2 mins at a time. It heats up in SECONDS! Use the continuous flow lock and you're good to go. The water needs to be refilled often since it's a small container, but I can steam 6-8 pieces of clothes only refilling once. Not a big deal. Overall, this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: It’s a win!
customer_reviews.text: My first one broke and I was very disappointed and left a 1 star review. A new one was sent to me very promptly and I have been using it for months without issue. I’ll never iron again. Total game changer. Just this morning when I was getting ready for work I steamed 3 different shirts because I could decide what to wear. It’s so incredibly fast, it heats up in seconds, and I don’t have to worry about burning my clothes or setting stains in like with an iron.
customer_reviews.author: MGN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - does not remove wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time reviewing different steamers and reading tons of reviews. I settled on this one, and was excited to get a handheld steamer to replace my large, standing steamer. The steamer looks well made and feels solid, but unfortunately it did not do what it's intended to do - remove wrinkles. I tried a variety of materials, and it did not work on any of them. I barely noticed an effect on wrinkles. It's back to my large, clunky steamer (which actually works).
customer_reviews.author: Delmar

customer_reviews.title: I BARELY GOT IT AND IT DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: After following the direction the activation button powers goes on but no steam comes out. The steamer is producing a loud humming noise even with the water on proper level, but nothing is actually steaming. It was working for the first few minutes and after it just stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Wong

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: This is the only steamer ive used so i really have nothing to compare it to but id say it does the job just fine. Beware of water randomly squirting out especially when you first turn it on. I find that if you hold the steamer close to your clothes nothing really happens, but if you lightly touch the heated part to your clothes youll get results. You stuff will get a little wet but it drys pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh Wu

customer_reviews.title: Defective or just a bad steamer
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if mine is defective, but it makes loud sound when in use (almost as if it's about to explode). The steam does not come out evenly and this results in poor functioning. Will try again tomorrow and see if I should return it or not.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Leaks everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: This steamer leaks a lot! I’m returning mine. I steamed a couple of shirts with it, but it leaks constantly. Spend a little more and get a reputable brand name steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen SD

customer_reviews.title: Leaky!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until it started to leak and soak. I’ve only had it for 4 months. I hope that they have warranty and honor it.
customer_reviews.author: Ladycel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Received a malfunctioning steamer. It puffed out some steam once and then made a grinding noise when i pressed the steam button. Now the standby mode light just keeps flashing. I am so annoyed. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This steamer has multiple attachments which allows me to put creases in certain garments or collect lint or hair on my clothes. The steamer has a big enough water reservoir that I can steam a full load of laundry before having to refill it. Overall a great steamer for those who want to press/ steam out wrinkles in their clothes. The materials feel of good quality and I expect the steamer to last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie J Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Watched an YouTube where a mom recommended using a steamer
customer_reviews.text: Life changing! I have never owned a steamer before, and ironing has never been my thing. I could spend 20 mins and still got a wrinkle shirt in my hand. Watched an YouTube where a mom recommended using a steamer. Searched on Amazon and saw this one that have many many great reviews, the price is affordable, so I gave a try. It literally took few minutes to iron shirts! For my busy life but not very organized in many different ways, THIS IS THE BOMB! It does iron the wrinkles in a few minutes! Can't say enough on how fast and easy to get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Min H

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Work!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product did not work at all for me or my husband. Clothes are still wrinkled. I tried it on different materials/garments. I’m really disappointed because of the great reviews. I’m going to have to buy a different one. ***update***The company did contact me after reading my review and offered a replacement product or a refund. I chose to take the refund because I do not believe I received a defective product, I just don’t think their product works. I do commend the company for reaching out to me and offering a remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Staples

customer_reviews.title: Before & After wrinkly dress shirt. Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This was a brand new packaged shirt that hadn't been washer yet. It did great. Simple machine and felt good while using. I'm not an ironing expert but I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda O’dell

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: This little steamer isn’t so bad. It’s great for clothing that cannot be ironed or that doesn’t need a serious ironing. I like how it takes out the wrinkles in my shirts and even my cloth face masks after I wash them. I tried it on a comforter I just purchased and although the after pictures do it no justice, the steamer actually took out most of the wrinkles. For the price , it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is Great, but Stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: Update. I reached out to customer service who responded in less than 24 hrs and had another one shipped to me immediately. It was nice they were so responsive, but it still should work for longer than a month. Bumping from a one star to four star rating because of their helpfulness! I loved this steamer until it stopped working after a month. Now the green light just blinks, it doesn't heat, and I cant return it because the return policy was only 30 days. I was truly hoping this would last, but it seems not.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: I hate ironing
customer_reviews.text: I hate ironing, and had multiple steamers that i returned after 1 use (including big semi industrial one from costco). they all spit out water, and dont do much of anything in my opinion. steamers are the necessary evil though, when it comes to coats, jackets and drapes. this little bugger though, i think i steamed even stuff that wasnt in line to be steamed... love the functionality, zero spitting, quick to heat up and quick to stop.
customer_reviews.author: askolga

customer_reviews.title: The lint attachment works excellent in that you can get rid of wrinkles and ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this steamer on just about everything. With three kids who wear uniforms to school this had cut my work in half. The lint attachment works excellent in that you can get rid of wrinkles and lint at the same time. I've had no leakage problems. I use it on furniture to kill gems, curtains, clothes, sheets, you name it I steam it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ædãœ

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working within a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my wife and she really liked it in the beginning. Unfortunately it just stopped working. I would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Kunal

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works great on t-shirts em dresses. I only had problem with my husband's short, maybe because of the fabric, it is not so soft. I don't know what it is but it is hard to make wrinkle free. Anyway, I really like it because it is light weight and you will get your job done very easy and fast. It is perfect for travel. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rosieli

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This steamer far exceeded my expectations. I am an interior/architectural photographer, and use this to steam wrinkles out of bedding and drapes. Most of my jobs are travel work, and this fits in one of my gear cases very easily. My assistant, who is used to using a full sized pro steamer, has found no flaws with this unit either. Also to note - I used to arrive at a hotel for the week and hang my clothes in the bathroom and turn shower on hot for a half hour to release the suitcase wrinkles. I actually use this for that purpose now too.
customer_reviews.author: VwgnTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well against wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: I do not like ironing at all. Schlepping out an ironing board and attempting to iron is not my cup of tea. Instead, I purchased this steamer and have had a great experience with it. I hang the garment up on a hook and just push a button and the steam does all the work. It is a fabulous investment for all your apparel and acts quickly as well. In no less than a couple minutes your clothes look like you just got them professionally pressed at the dry cleaner, no lie. Great for travelers too it conveniently is lightweight and compact enough to fit in your luggage or carry on bags.
customer_reviews.author: ladyspaspa

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little steamer. It comes with a cup to make pouring the water into it easy. It also has a lock to keep the steam on so your not having to hold the button down while steaming your clothes. The only thing I would like to see added is a cloth cover for the end of the steamer as sometimes the steam does make certain materials have a wet spot or leaves condensation(it eventually dries with no stain) so I added a clean sock over my steamer head and it's perfect now. It also prevents lines/ridges from the steamer holes when you hold it against the fabric. Overall it's a great little steamer and works really good.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked 3 times just great and then broke, won't push steam out at all
customer_reviews.text: We used this product 3 times without issue and it worked great for steaming flat our clothes. However, it completely stopped outputting any water or steam one day. Doesn't seem to heat up either. We would like the company to contact us for a replacement since it's only been a few months since we purchased it, but do not know how to contact them. As it is we have to give it a one star for not working.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Pettigrew Review

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I like this steamer, it works really well on everything I’ve tried so far. I like the long cord and the function to turn the steam on continuously so you don’t have to hold the button down. My only criticism would be the water tank is kind of weird to fill. The opening for the reservoir is really small and kind of hard to access. There’s a rubber stopper that is hard to pull out, but once you get past that, using the cup with tiny spout (provided in the box) seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. It's cheap plastic, but it works! One of the components is falling apart. The red fabric is glued onto the conponent - and the steam makes the glue come off. So, bad design on that end. The add ons are a little gimmicky. Need to refill the bucket multiple times to steam more than one object. 1 star = does not work 2 stars = barely works 3 stars = average, it works 4 stars = it works well 5 stars = it works well and all parts are designed to last
customer_reviews.author: Sara Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Compact~~ Replacing my full size steamer~~
customer_reviews.text: I just received this a few days ago. The size is much much smaller than my full size vertical steamer~ My vertical steamer finally died and it takes up A LOT of space on the floor. With this little guy, I'm excited that I'll have my floor space back. I like that the water container clear so I can see how much water is in there. Small foot print is a HUGE plus~~ The steam won't last as long as my full size, but her, there's always a trade off. And it should have enough water for me to steam out several outfit before I need refill. Will update my review once i use it continuously for a few week~~
customer_reviews.author: Mechie

customer_reviews.title: Well made, steaks up quickly and no leak
customer_reviews.text: Great steamer. Very powerful flow of steam. I had to refill the tank once to completely steam a long linen dress, which is the only disappointment with this steamer. Not to heavy to handle.. The brush attachment works very well. It is large for a travel steamer, but packed easily along the edge of a big suitcase. It has a long cord, which was nice in a hotel with limited outlets. It is far superior to my older, small conair travel steamer. The small tank is easy to fill and did not leak. It must be held completely upright for steam to flow. I experienced only a few small sputters of water.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Am I using this right?
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions on the technique you're supposed to use when using this on clothes and how to operate this particular steamer and it doesn't really seem to have any effect. I spent a good 10-15 minutes on one shirt just trying to see if I could get the wrinkles out of even a small section of the shirt and it didn't seem to really do anything. The steam kind of piddles out and the wrinkles stayed. I'm going to keep trying it and see if I should be doing anything different and if I find a better way then I'll update the review...
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good steamer and amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this steamer and didn't get around to using it for about two months. Luckily, I had signed up for their extended warranty on the product's website (which was free and also super simple). When I went to use it the first time, it was defective and I was past the amazon return window. I emailed the company with my warranty info and the immediately sent out a brand new item - no shipping fees, didn't have to return the old one, and it arrive within two days. The new steamer is fabulous - the reservoir holds quite a lot of water and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: SanDiegoMama

customer_reviews.title: Works, a little heavy for long use
customer_reviews.text: Its great, it works. Its convenient to steam a couple of shirts but I found it pretty tiring to hold it up after a while. Its supposed to work horizontally faced down too, and it does for a bit but the water suction doesn't reach the water at some angle. If you attach the brush (which is great to collect lint and smoothe the surface!) water droplets may form in between and thus it appears to leak a bit. The hold button that allows continuous steaming is a great function. Overall its great for quick ironing/travel but not for big loads for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jaewonywon

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I could not decide which steamer to get and just ended up picking this one due to the reviews and I do not regret it! It heats up so fast and is easy to fill and empty with water. I can easily do a weeks worth of clothes for work without refilling the water. So much better than getting the iron out (which I rarely did before). I used to continuously try to throw clothes back in the dryer or rewash them or use my straightener but this is a life changer. I am so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Product works well so far. To get a good amount of steam you need to put it in constant release. Works well removing wrinkles, make sure you don't get it too close to the clothe because it can get them wet (obviously it's steam) but this might cause some wrinkles as well. I really like the accessories it brings, especially the one to remove lint. The steamer it's heavy and with any other similar product it helps if you were gloves to avoid burns and have a good hanger. You can use tap water but they recommend distille.
customer_reviews.author: Berenice

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I bought this product! I have not had an iron for a very long time because it's basically just inconvenient. This device is great because you can steam your clothes while they hang, so you don't need an ironing board. I also love the attachments for lint, fur, debris, etc - they actually work! It heats up very quickly and decreases wrinkles just as fast. Much less effort than a standard iron. The extension cord is long so it's easy to move around. It's small enough to store away when not in use and is lightweight if you want to bring it with you somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Archambault

customer_reviews.title: Great for wrinkle removal, creates nice creases.
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer but it's a bit heavy if operating it on a horizontal board. It also eminates a lot of heat where I grasp it. I had to cover it with multiple layers of packing tape where my hand holds it because it is too hot. Aside from the weight and heat near the grasping area it steams better than my full size conair model.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I hate ironing, almost as much as I hate folding clothes. I have bought many different kinds of these and they all leak or won't stay on. The design is really great on this one, it heats up fast and doesn't leak (at least not yet, I will update if it does). You can heat it up without it steaming and just being on. I think (fingers crossed) that this one will be the last. I do feel like it should bet a little more power, or heat, or steam? Not sure what exactly would make it a little more powerful, but sometimes you have to go over spot three or four times.
customer_reviews.author: Christina C Kochan

customer_reviews.title: Easier than ironing new curtains!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased surrey pleated twill drapes from Ballard Design and found myself frustrated by yards of stubbornly creased, heavy fabric. After ironing for what seemed like eternity on the first panel, I gave up and ordered this steamer. I won’t say the wrinkles are 100% gone (fabric is a bear) but the steamer worked better than the iron and in, easily, a quarter of the time. After seeing results, we ended up steaming the previously ironed panel. Kind of feels like a luxury purchase for a first world problem—admittedly not something I’ll use often—BUT I’m sure happy to have it. So SO much easier than ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Puckerman

customer_reviews.title: Quit working the first day
customer_reviews.text: I had a several curtains I needed to steam. It seemed to be fine initially, and I got through maybe four curtains. The effectiveness isn't great, but it was better than a standing steamer I had. Then it stopped working the third time I went to use it. Refilled the tank, and the light would turn on as usual, but no steam would come out. Tried the usual troubleshooting things, but still nothing. I'm getting a replacement, but we'll see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when my steamer arrived, but was quickly disappointed. I work in a professional office setting and need a neat appearance. The steamer heats up fast and puts out good steam, it just doesn't take the wrinkles out. I refilled the water reservoir to the max line three times for one article of clothing and it still left wrinkles. I also found that the steam is so hot you cannot hold the article of clothing enough without burning yourself. I tried using an oven mitt but that makes it too clumsy to work with the article of clothing. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item to steam the wrinkles out of some new drapes and it worked great. Have not tried it yet but based upon how well it worked with the drapes, we expect it will work just as well on clothes. Kind of large for travel in our opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Roberge Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Steamer
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great steamer! I find it hard to iron because it just dangerous to have around my 18 month old. This steamer has different features and you have an option to let the steamer run instead of having to hold it down. This definitely does the job and it comes with attachments I never knew I would need. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is the plastic smell that comes out from the water.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Wrinkle free
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I hate ironing. Everytime I do, I seem to get weird marks on my clothes or just can't get all the wrinkles out. I used to have a different clothes steamer which leaked water everywhere so stopped using that of course. Thought I'd try a different clothes steamer and I'm glad I did. No leaking! Does what it was designed to do and gets those wrinkles out. I wouldn't travel with it but I usually pack wrinkle free clothing
customer_reviews.author: S. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Take it slow as you drag the steamer
customer_reviews.text: The left panel 👈 in the pic is with the steamer, and the right panel 👉 is with no treatment. I bought this and tried it on some thin sheets and thought it didn't work well. I just finished doing our new, thick, black-out drapes: I realize I was doing it wrong, before. This time I used the red brush attachment right against the fabric, held the end of the drapes taught, and moved slowly down the fabric. 4 stars because it exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Weird Noise 1 week after
customer_reviews.text: Steamer started making a noise after a week of usage. Potency is not the same.
customer_reviews.author: Eixiel Taboada

customer_reviews.title: Best steamer out there
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the Best steamer I have ever used. It does not squirt water like my past steamers have. It takes less than a minute to heat up fully. I can steam three polo shirts and three pairs of pants without having to worry about refilling the water. It gets out even the toughest wrinkles! It’s also small so it’s perfect for travel. I am very very pleased with this purchase and I would purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: What is that horrible noise??
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to trying this steamer. I received it, read the instructions and attempted to steam. As soon as I pressed the steam release button, it started clicking loudly. After several attempts I realized the noise wasted going to stop. I continued to try to steam anyway. Steam did come out for a few seconds and then stopped. I was so disappointed I just put it aside and didn't even bother returning to Amazon. I need to order another steamer but after this horrible choice I'm a little apprehensive.
customer_reviews.author: wanda jones

customer_reviews.title: This does exactly what it is supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: I like instant STEAM....if a minute went by....I didn't notice it. Full Steam ahead, goodbye Wrinkles....almost instantly! I like the large capacity for water. I steamed 5-6 items without refilling at all...!! I hate stopping to refill, so size of water tank amazing! I am very, very impressed and extremely happy I bought this. Didn't like: I had my eye on a much more attractive one, same size, same price....but small water tank. That larger tank means a lot if you are busy! I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Birdy

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to Las Vegas to steam my wedding dress and my husband's suit. I only had the other reviews to go by, when deciding which steamer to order. This one did not disappoint! I don't think I'll ever iron again. Honestly! It has a water compartment that snaps in and out with ease. It heats up and is ready in under 20 seconds. Easily refillable. It traveled in my carry-on bag on the way there (along with our wedding attire, to be safe), but traveled in checked baggage on the way home. No problems or hangups. I am impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Clack

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Quality, and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: An iron just wasn’t doing it for me and my delicate blouses and jumpsuits so I ordered this. Amazing! In the past I bought a travel steamer from a well known brand and it always leaked. Not a problem with this as this is a really solid product. The lint removing attachment really come in handy as I have multiple pets. I am really happy with this and I will update as need be. Now it is a bit large to travel in a small carry on but on a business trip or even on a photo shoot, this is perfect to bring along.
customer_reviews.author: UrbanDiatribe

customer_reviews.title: Update-useless, Removed those semi-permanent blouse fold lines!
customer_reviews.text: Update 12/04/19: had to change the review from 5 stars to 1. Used it once and it worked great. Emptied the tank as it said to and now a month later it won't steam at all. Followed all the troubleshooting and couldn't get it to work. :( This steamer is great! I'm used to one of the ones that has the water tank on wheels so this handheld one was a great change. The different heads are nice for different fabrics. I was able to steam the lines out of my fancier blouses that have semi-permanent fold lines that even washing didn't remove!
customer_reviews.author: cloud9

customer_reviews.title: Great portable steamer
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived very quickly and before time. I wish had got this product earlier. Its really great portable steamer and is very easy to use and carry. I have been looking for this kind of product and I found it. It takes very little time to iron clothes. I would definitely recommend this product. Great product. We're very happy with it and would definitely recommend it. The price is very reasonable. I would rate more than 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Manan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this handheld steamer based off thousands of good reviews. I needed to replace an older model Rowenta. The set up and ease of use on this is amazing! After hanging new curtains, I used this attached to an extra long extension cord and was able to easily steam curtain panels in two different rooms. The water chamber is simple to fill and reinstall. Overall, highly recommend! It seems a little bulky to take traveling but cannot speak to that personally.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Won't replace your iron, but great addition
customer_reviews.text: Took a few uses to figure things out, but the steamer works really well. I have found it works best to press the steamer against the garment, not hold it away. I don't think this will replace my regular iron, but is really great with hard-to-iron things like wool, silk, bulky/large items.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Best fabric steamer I've used so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a couple of fabric steamers in the past and this one blows all the other ones out of the water. It's very quick to heat up and I like that I could use this as an iron as well. The attachments make this product stand out because I can use the attachments for different effects such as lint removal, crease removal, and dust removal. Automatic safety shut off is a big positive because it gives me the sense of mind that if I ever forgot to turn this device off, it would turn itself off. I wish it came with some sort of carrying bag though.
customer_reviews.author: ap619

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this to take to a wedding I was in, but I really love it and have used it very often! I do not enjoy ironing because it involves a lot more work - setting up the board, plugging in the iron, waiting for it to heat up, and then putting everything away. With this steamer, I just plug it in and turn it on. In the time it takes me to brush my teeth, it’s heated and ready to go! I just hang my garment and steam it quickly, then turn it off, unplug it, and set it where my cat can’t reach. Much faster and more convenient than a traditional iron.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Amazing steamer and amazing company
customer_reviews.text: I like it but the lint part came off the first time I used it. The red cloth part came off and I tried to get a replacement part but couldn’t find one. Update: the company actually reached out to me and offered to send me a replacement and I received it in two days. I am impressed and very happy. I have been using steamers for years, and this by far is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: SueZanne

customer_reviews.title: Great if you hate ironing like me!
customer_reviews.text: I hate ironing. So I switched to steamers several years ago. The biggest problem with the traditional ones are they’re bulky, and the stagnant water eventually gunks things up, and I’ve had to replace several times (they’re not cheap). When I saw this steamer, it changed my world. It heats up in no time. And the steam is “on demand” when you pull the trigger. It sounds like it sprays water on the heat element to make steam. It is pretty compact, and would fit into a carry on bag relatively easily.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I was sent a USED product.
customer_reviews.text: I was SO excited for this product... But mine was definitely a return that had already been used. There is some kind of cat or animal hair all over the product and box, questionable smudges, and the labels have all been previously peeled on both as well. I'm sorry, but you can't just box up a returned item without checking the quality and leave your customers with zero knowledge of what it was previously returned for. It very well could be defective, and it's in too gross of a condition for me to even want to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I’ve ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: Read many of the reviews because I didn’t want another gimmick. The final one that caught my attention and had me believing this was the steamer to buy was the lady that does fashion shows and steams the clothing for all of the events. When she gave it rave reviews I knew I had to try it. I’ve never been disappointed with it! In fact I’m going to share this new gem I’ve come upon through Christmas presents this year! If you’re thinking about it - get it!
customer_reviews.author: KEKEE

customer_reviews.title: I'VE BECOME A STEAMAHOLIC AND CAN'T STOP MYSELF!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can not believe how POWERFUL this portable steamer is! Super easy to use and when I plugged it in it was ready in about 40 seconds. I've gone crazy in my home with the bedding, drapes etc - I don't know if I was just one of the many lucky buyers that didn't receive a defective one but I am truly amazed at how good this steamer works. BTW, I use distilled water in mine :-) TRY IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself on first use - Suits and Cowboy Hats - Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This little handy steamer paid for itself on the first use. Purchased it for steaming suits - pressed two in a matter of minutes. Which now saved me the cost of the product. However, then was able to re-shape two of my cowboy hats, which worked very well and again saved me the cost of the product. Thus, in its first go around with this handy little product was able to pay for it twice. Puts out amble amount of steam, hand held of sits on the counter. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this steamer for baby clothes as my dryer doesn't seem to get the wrinkles out of most of the smaller clothing. This is easy to use and works great! I did have a different/smaller/cheaper steamer but it is now in the trash because it always spit out water an would stop go, stop go, etc. This one does not spit water an has continuous flow with an auto switch which i like. Although its a little more bulkier then my last, i see if being useful for future vacation trips! Overall ive steamed about 20 outfits an impressed at the quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rauch

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: i love how this steamer does not keep shutting off from being overheated like my previous two. i get the same job done much quicker with this one. only thing is its also bulkier and i don’t see myself traveling with it, but thats not a big deal. i also like the steel plate which helps smooth out the wrinkles like an iron. i’m pleased with this purchase. just make sure you get a brand spanking new one, unlike the first one that was sent to me which was obviously used and returned!
customer_reviews.author: gc

customer_reviews.title: Returning after first use
customer_reviews.text: I’m returning the steamer after my first use because the water reservoir opening is so small it’s near impossible to get any water in, even with the included cup or anything else. I can’t rate the steam heat or performance because very little water is inside to get any action. Not good for traveling I think it’s too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Functions well, excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first steamer I have ever used, let alone purchased. I have ironed my clothes daily for years now and was hoping this steamer would help free up the space that an ironing board takes. I'm happy to say it does that. It looked great, very simple to operated, easy to handle, instruction an easy read as well. No great amount of clean up. I LOVE IT!!! I have not traveled with it yet, but very easy to pack.Smooth wrinkles out with out a lot of steam, no dripping when steaming. I can see myself constantly using this one for the near future. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nisaanthakumar Nithyanandam

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the steamer that I've been searching for! I have bought 3 different steamers and I have finally found one that works great! It doesn't leak. It doesn't "spit" water at the clothes. It actually removes wrinkles and is lightweight! This is my daughter's dress. It's a tricky, dress shirt like material, that wrinkles so easily. I tried various steamers (and an iron) to get the wrinkles out after washing and nothing worked well. Until this little beauty of a steamer! Here are some before and after pics. I highly recommend this steamer!
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye iron !!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after a friend of mine raved about her steamer. I do all of the ironing in the house which can be time consuming. After using the steamer a few times , I don’t think I’ll ever take out my iron again! It heats up crazy fast , very easy to use and doesn’t drip water all over the clothes. So far , I’ve used it on a few shirts, a pair of shorts and one of my wife’s summer dresses. It comes with a few attachments but so far I haven’t had the need to use them. My poor iron is going into storage , lol
customer_reviews.author: Arztpt

customer_reviews.title: Use it almost daily
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go to for clothing prep. Its easy to steam wrinkles out of almost anything, but I use it often on suit pants and even dress shirts. It replaced a basic 'travel steamer' and I can't believe I didn't upgrade sooner. Being able to use it in any direction (even directly downward) is a great plus for working with clothing. I highly recommend this to anyone who would otherwise frequently be ironing. I've barely touched my iron in months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Badly designed water tank
customer_reviews.text: Water opening on the tank is small and the tank is hard to fill. The opening is in such a location that you can't drain all the water out when you're done using the steamer, and it's super annoying to keep the tank out for a few days waiting for the water to evaporate. Definitely not convenient for travel. On top of that, it didn't really remove wrinkles all that well -- I'm going back to my iron.
customer_reviews.author: Chris812

customer_reviews.title: Used in place of an iron
customer_reviews.text: I hang my clothes on a hanger put it on the curtain rod in the bathroom. Takes about 30 seconds to warm up, then another 1 - 2 minutes to get the wrinkles out. I like that I don't have to bother with an ironing table.
customer_reviews.author: Dd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fast to get your work done
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time purchase garment steamer from amazon, i’ve been searching for an easy use, quick and reasonable price steamer for so long. After I compared few of them online, I decided to give a try for this one. It’s not really heavy and easy to use. It takes less than 1 minute to get ready to steam my shirts. And I’m so happy that how it can get rid of all those folded lines and wrinkles away from my shirts. From now on, I don’t need to borrow my mom’s old school iron to iron my clothes which takes forever to iron. I will highly recommend to my friends and families for this great product. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted...just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This product is light weight, portable, and does the job. My daughter has a very large garment steamer that I admired but did not want one that took up as much room. I was doubtful but hopeful that one this small would do the job and it does! I need to steam only one or two garments once or twice a week and this does the job as well as her larger one for that. If I had many garments to do at once the small water chamber would prove bothersome to refill but it is more than adequate for my one-two small lightweight garments at a time needs.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good gun parts steamer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for cold bluing and found that the auto off was a pain, so I do not recommand it for steaming gun parts. But this works great for steaming wrinkeled clothes! I think that I might take my iron and board to the range because this sorry gun parts steamer works great on clothes. No need for an old fashion iron anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with extra perks!
customer_reviews.text: Got it after my Conair hand-held steamer started leaking water everywhere. It did a beautiful job steaming out the wrinkles on my thick, double-layered blackout curtains. The large water tank is great and best of all, no leakage whether turning it on its side, down or upright. It also heats up quickly and you can slide the trigger button down to keep a steady steam going or have it only turn on when you press the trigger (so no steam if you need to set it down). I'm extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmm
customer_reviews.text: It worked well the first few times i used it but after awhile it used so much water the clothes would feel damp and the wrinkles just came right back. I was a little disappointed but maybe I just expected more from it. This was the first steamer I'd ever purchased. I sent it back and will try a different brand. Now I've got something to compare them to
customer_reviews.author: Adenton67

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little steamer with removable tank
customer_reviews.text: Great little steamer! It heats up fast, and has a removable water tank so it's easy to fill without having to unplug the device. It has a pull trigger to start the steaming, or you can slide it into a locked position to stay on without having to hold it down with your finger. It can steam in almost any position, unlike my other steamer that had to be perfectly vertical to work correctly. I've traveled with it, too, and it was easy to pack. I wish I had purchased this steamer sooner! It has made getting wrinkles out of clothes and curtains so easy breezy.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to wardrobe and saves time over ironing
customer_reviews.text: I have used this steamer on bed linens and blouses and it heats up fast, uses regular tap water and gets out the wrinkles, although slightly tugging on the item to be steamed is usually more effective than just holding it over the fabric. The water tank has to be refilled more often than I expected. It does not streak water on a horizontal surface—important for bed linens. I have not used it for traveling yet. I read recently that these kill bed bugs.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Steamy
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy a steamer for myself after using one from a friend on a trip. I bought this one on the recommendation of Amazon. It worked great out of the box, but after a couple uses the out put of steam died down. And if you leave water in the tank during storage it might not work the next time you try to use it. So in conclusion it's a great steamer. But take the extra step of emptying the water tank and clearing what's inside before putting it away for storage
customer_reviews.author: Dexter M.

product_meta.title: BEAUTURAL Steamer for Clothes with Pump Steam Technology, Portable Handheld Garment Fabric Wrinkles Remover, 30s Fast Heat-up, Auto-Off, Large Detachable Water Tank
feature_bullets: REMOVE WRINKLES FAST AND EFFICIENTLY - preheats in only 30 seconds, with detachable large 260ml (8.79 oz.) water tank for 15 minutes of continuous steaming.
SAFE TO USE ON ALL FABRICS - cotton, wool, polyester, plush, silk, fiber, nylon, velvet and linen, suitable for clothes, bedding, table clothes, sofas, toys and so much more.
UNIQUE LEAK-PROOF DESIGN - Thanks to the Pump Steam Technology, No leaking, No spilling, allows steam your clothes while hanging vertically or lying horizontally.
FREE 3 REMOVABLE ATTACHMENTS - fabric brush, creaser, and Lint brush provide versatile steaming options.
WE CARE ABOUT YOUR EXPERIENCE - Our California based office ensures a quick response to your problems.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,377 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
